verses.kjv: And Bezaleel made the ark of shittim wood: two cubits and a half was the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it:
verses.ct: Bezalel constructed the ark from acacia wood. It was 3 and 3/4 feet long, 2 and 1/4 feet wide, and 2 and 1/4 feet tall.

verses.kjv: And he overlaid it with pure gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.
verses.ct: He covered it inside and out with pure gold and crafted a gold molding that ran all the way around it.

verses.kjv: And he cast for it four rings of gold, to be set by the four corners of it; even two rings upon the one side of it, and two rings upon the other side of it.
verses.ct: He cast 4 gold rings and attached them to its 4 feet — 2 rings on one side and 2 rings on the other.

verses.kjv: And he made staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
verses.ct: He crafted carrying poles from acacia wood and covered them with gold.

verses.kjv: And he put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
verses.ct: He slid the poles through the rings on the sides of the ark so it could be carried.

verses.kjv: And he made the mercy seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half was the length thereof, and one cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
verses.ct: He made the mercy seat from pure gold, 3 and 3/4 feet long and 2 and 1/4 feet wide.

verses.kjv: And he made two cherubims of gold, beaten out of one piece made he them, on the two ends of the mercy seat;
verses.ct: He made 2 cherubim out of hammered gold, forming them from a single piece at the 2 ends of the mercy seat.

verses.kjv: One cherub on the end on this side, and another cherub on the other end on that side: out of the mercy seat made he the cherubims on the two ends thereof.
verses.ct: One cherub was at one end and the other cherub was at the opposite end. He formed the cherubim as one piece with the mercy seat at both ends.

verses.kjv: And the cherubims spread out their wings on high, and covered with their wings over the mercy seat, with their faces one to another; even to the mercy seatward were the faces of the cherubims.
verses.ct: The cherubim had their wings spread upward, overshadowing the mercy seat with them. They faced each other, looking down toward the mercy seat.

verses.kjv: And he made the table of shittim wood: two cubits was the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof:
verses.ct: He built the table from acacia wood. It was 3 feet long, 1 and 1/2 feet wide, and 2 and 1/4 feet tall.

verses.kjv: And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made thereunto a crown of gold round about.
verses.ct: He covered it with pure gold and added a gold molding all the way around it.

verses.kjv: Also he made thereunto a border of an handbreadth round about; and made a crown of gold for the border thereof round about.
verses.ct: He also made a rim about 3 inches wide around it, with a gold molding along the edge of the rim.

verses.kjv: And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings upon the four corners that were in the four feet thereof.
verses.ct: He cast 4 gold rings and fastened them at the 4 corners where the 4 legs were.

verses.kjv: Over against the border were the rings, the places for the staves to bear the table.
verses.ct: The rings were positioned close to the rim to hold the carrying poles for the table.

verses.kjv: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.
verses.ct: He made the carrying poles from acacia wood and covered them with gold for transporting the table.

verses.kjv: And he made the vessels which were upon the table, his dishes, and his spoons, and his bowls, and his covers to cover withal, of pure gold.
verses.ct: Then he made all the utensils that went on the table — the plates, dishes, bowls, and pitchers for pouring drink offerings — all from pure gold.

verses.kjv: And he made the candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work made he the candlestick; his shaft, and his branch, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers, were of the same:
verses.ct: He crafted the lampstand from pure gold, hammering it into shape. Its base, shaft, cups, buds, and blossoms were all formed from one piece.

verses.kjv: And six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:
verses.ct: 6 branches extended from its sides — 3 branches from one side and 3 branches from the other.

verses.kjv: Three bowls made after the fashion of almonds in one branch, a knop and a flower; and three bowls made like almonds in another branch, a knop and a flower: so throughout the six branches going out of the candlestick.
verses.ct: Each branch had 3 almond-shaped cups, each with a bud and a blossom. This pattern was the same on all 6 branches extending from the lampstand.

verses.kjv: And in the candlestick were four bowls made like almonds, his knops, and his flowers:
verses.ct: On the central shaft of the lampstand itself, there were 4 almond-shaped cups with their buds and blossoms.

verses.kjv: And a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, according to the six branches going out of it.
verses.ct: There was a bud beneath the first pair of branches, a bud beneath the second pair, and a bud beneath the third pair — corresponding to all 6 branches extending from it.

verses.kjv: Their knops and their branches were of the same: all of it was one beaten work of pure gold.
verses.ct: The buds and branches were all part of the lampstand itself — the whole thing was one single piece of hammered pure gold.

verses.kjv: And he made his seven lamps, and his snuffers, and his snuffdishes, of pure gold.
verses.ct: He made its 7 lamps, along with its wick trimmers and trays, all from pure gold.

verses.kjv: Of a talent of pure gold made he it, and all the vessels thereof.
verses.ct: He used one talent of pure gold to make the lampstand and all its accessories.

verses.kjv: And he made the incense altar of shittim wood: the length of it was a cubit, and the breadth of it a cubit; it was foursquare; and two cubits was the height of it; the horns thereof were of the same.
verses.ct: He built the incense altar from acacia wood. It was square, 1 and 1/2 feet long and 1 and 1/2 feet wide, and 3 feet tall. Its horns were formed as one piece with it.

verses.kjv: And he overlaid it with pure gold, both the top of it, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it: also he made unto it a crown of gold round about.
verses.ct: He covered the top, all the sides, and the horns with pure gold, and he made a gold molding all the way around it.

verses.kjv: And he made two rings of gold for it under the crown thereof, by the two corners of it, upon the two sides thereof, to be places for the staves to bear it withal.
verses.ct: He made 2 gold rings and attached them below the molding on opposite sides to hold the carrying poles.

verses.kjv: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
verses.ct: He made the carrying poles from acacia wood and covered them with gold.

verses.kjv: And he made the holy anointing oil, and the pure incense of sweet spices, according to the work of the apothecary.
verses.ct: He also prepared the sacred anointing oil and the pure fragrant incense, blended like the work of a skilled perfumer.
